title: 'Neighbour from hell' who had 4am pool parties is selling house for £1million
text:

A woman branded a 'neighbour from hell' is selling her house for £1million - and residents are overjoyed.

Julie Rankine, who is in her mid 50s, has been in court twice in the last two years on charges relating to harassing her neighbours in Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham.

Residents in the road have said they are "over the moon" she appears to finally be going after claiming she 'made their lives hell'.

They say since she moved into the road nearly a decade ago, she has caused them stress, poor health and sleepless nights.

Her last appearance at court was in July of this year - when the divorced mother-of-two was found guilty of breaching a restraining order imposed to protect her neighbours forbidding her to have no contact with them.

This had been imposed on Rankine in 2017 after a trial at Birmingham Magistrates' Court where she was convicted of harassing her neighbours, including poking one with her walking stick and threatening another with an axe.

Neighbours told the court how these incidents were "just the tip of the iceberg" of a nine-year campaign of harassment, reports Birmingham Live .

(Image: Birmingham Mail/Iain Findlay)

(Image: RightMove/BPM Media)

This was said to have included sitting on her roof watching them in their gardens, playing loud music, holding parties in her outdoor swimming pool which went on until 4am and dumping rubbish on their properties.

The trial in July heard how one neighbour had even gone to the lengths of spending £4,000 building a gazebo so they could sit in their garden in privacy.

The court heard how Rankine had ran a small business designing tea-related pottery and utensils from the house, which she had got in her divorce settlement but which still had a mortgage on it.

At one point she applied for planning permission to open a tea-room at her house - complete with painting 12 parking bays on her large driveway - which neighbours claimed was actually a front for a brothel.

(Image: BPM Media)

(Image: RightMove/BPM Media)

When the For Sale board went up outside the house, neighbours said they "cheered with delight".

One nearby resident - who did not want to be named - said: "When we heard the house was up for sale it was the best news we'd heard.

"Ever since she moved in we've had nothing but trouble, misery and stress.

"This is such a nice place to live, but our lives have been ruined by her."

It is unclear if Rankine is currently living at the home.

(Image: Handout)

(Image: RightMove/BPM Media)

Sentencing Rankine back in March 2017 District Judge Ian Strongman had told her: “You are an unpleasant woman who has caused your neighbours’ lives to be hell and this is your come-uppance.”

He granted the restraining order against Rankine, which had 14 conditions, to run indefinitely.

The charges at her 2017 trial related to Rankine’s behaviour towards her immediate neighbours.

On three occasions in March, June and August of 2016 she poked at her neighbours through their adjoining fences with her walking stick, causing them injuries.

On the fourth occasion in the August she threatened one of the neighbours with an axe during a row over fence panels.

(Image: Birmingham Mail)

(Image: RightMove/BPM Media)

The court heard those incidents were “just the tip of an iceberg” of a nine-year campaign of harassment Rankine, 54, had waged against her neighbours.

Her detached house features five bedrooms - one with a balcony, two reception rooms, a cellar playroom, wet room entertaining and games room, self contained annexe, large garden and heated outdoor swimming pool.

It faces Sutton Park and has a large driveway with enough parking for 12 cars.

Estate agents Quantrills say on RightMove: "This is a very impressive double-fronted period family residence, occupying a mature setting in this sought-after and convenient residential location opposite Sutton Park."
description: Julie Rankine held parties in her outdoor swimming pool which went on until 4am, neighbours in Birmingham claimed
